Description: Neck sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe; interior reserved; exterior, pale slip: maeander and square pattern around neck; four-petalled rosette inside square; below, dividing band of short vertical strokes above ridge at junction of neck and shoulder.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The accession number on the sherd reads only H2779, 'b' has been added as there are seven other sherds with the same number. For parallels regarding the decoration, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.121.17. Cook places AN1896-1908-G.121.17 into his group of 'Miscellaneous Oinochoai', H2779.b may belong to the same group.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.120)
